official-title.#text:
To prohibit the use of Federal funds for real property or
		  for a project or program named for an individual then serving as a Member of
		  Congress, including a Delegate or Resident Commissioner to Congress, or as
		  President.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
committee-name.#text:
Committee on Oversight and Government
			 Reform

committee-name.#tail:
, for a period to be subsequently determined by
			 the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within
			 the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
No Monuments to Me Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

No Federal funds may
			 be used for real property (including structures, buildings, or other
			 infrastructure) or for a project or program named for an individual then
			 serving as a Member of Congress, including a Delegate or Resident Commissioner
			 to the Congress, or as President.

This section shall not apply with respect
			 to any Presidential library.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not apply with respect to
			 any project or program commenced, or any real property named, prior to the date
			 of the enactment of this Act, regardless of whether the authorization for such
			 project or program or for the use of such real property has expired.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: No Monuments to Me Act of 2013/s:2

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 1826 IH: No Monuments to Me Act of 2013
